tool.name: Create3DManholes

param.name: InputFeatures
param.dialogReference: Select the 2D manhole points layer to convert to 3D

param.name: UpperInvertElevation
param.dialogReference: Select the attribute that represents the elevation of the manhole rim.

param.name: LowerInvertElevation
param.dialogReference:
Select the attribute that represents the elevation of the manhole invert.

Note: if you have modeled invert depth, please recalculate to invert elevation.

param.name: InvertElevationUnit
param.dialogReference:
Set elevation unit for the selected rim and invert elevation attributes.

Note: a new field will be added to the feature class converting the elevation values to the linear units of the input layer. If no units are specified, invert elevation units are considered the same as the linear units.

param.name: Diameter
param.dialogReference: Select the attribute that represents the diameter for the manholes. If no attribute is set, the default diameter value will be used for all manholes.

param.name: DiameterUnit
param.dialogReference:
Set diameter unit for the selected diameter attribute.

Note: a new field will be added to the feature class converting the diameter values to the linear units of the input layer. If no units are specified, diameter units are considered the same as the linear units.

param.name: DefaultDiameter
param.dialogReference: If no diameter attribute is set or has missing values, the default diameter value will be used.

param.name: OutputAs3DObjects
param.dialogReference: Toggle on if you want to output 3D objects as well as 3D points.

param.name: Treat0asError
param.dialogReference: Toggle on if the value of 0 in the rim and invert elevaton attributes is to be treated as an error.

param.name: ErrorElevationValue
param.dialogReference: Set the elevation value to use if the rim or invert elevation is not known.

param.name: InterpolateErrors
param.dialogReference:
Toggle on if you want to interpolate invert elevations based on the known good invert elevation values in the dataset.

Note: a surface will be intepolated through the known good invert elevations. Points with Null or 0 values (if 0 is consifered to be an error) will be interpolated on to that surface and receive an error code of 2.

param.name: TerrainSurface
param.dialogReference: Enter the terrain surface that can be used to interpolate manhole rim elevations.

tool.summary: Creates 3D manholes from 2D manhole points plus elevation attributes.
